meaning: To give substance or true existence to.
To show to be true or real by giving evidence; prove; confirm.
To give concrete form or body to; convert into substance; embody.
sentences: Now, in the excited state of popular feeling at that period, the failure of government to substantiate an accusation of treason would have been a serious matter.
There is not one shred of evidence to substantiate the allegations made.
You should be able to fully substantiate every claim that you make; adding qualifications where required.
The Dalton figure for the treble nominal I was unable to substantiate, I cannot find anything at that frequency in my recording.
